description: Follow text and radio commentary as Manchester Originals face London Spirit in the 2023 Men's Hundred.
title: The Hundred 2023 LIVE: Manchester Originals vs London Spirit in men's competition plus score, commentary, video highlights & updates
title_page: The Hundred 2023 LIVE: Manchester Originals vs London Spirit in men's competition plus score, commentary, video highlights & updates - BBC Sport
maintext:
Match abandoned at Old Trafford
The men's Phoenix-Rockets match at Edgbaston is still scheduled for tonight, so we'll keep tabs on the prospects there for you.
Our coverage is due to resume at 17:45 so hopefully we'll see you then!
Post
Phoebe Graham
Manchester Originals bowler on BBC Radio
It'll be a disappointing afternoon for Originals, they got off to a fantastic start and Butter put the team in a great position, but at least we saw a little bit of cricket at Old Trafford.
Originals 138-5
We need to be back on by 17:12 BST for a 25-ball second innings. I'm not too far from Old Trafford, and it doesn't look good at the moment.
Birmingham Phoenix v Trent Rockets abandoned
Unfortunately, the rain has won at Birmingham.
The women's game between Phoenix and Trent Rockets has been abandoned - the second of the day after Manchester Originals and London Spirit suffered the same fate earlier.
That means only three games in the women's competition have been completed so far because of the weather.
Originals 138-5
Matthew Wade slides along by the boundary to stop a four, but he's gesticulating to the umpires about the conditions out in the deep. He's never short of a word or two at the best of times, is the ex-Australia keeper-batter.
Originals 126-4
Ashton Turner is the new batter, and he gets the chance to shine at a free hit when Ravi Bopara sends down a beamer as the ball slips out of his hands.
Turner can only get two from the free hit when he pulls it behind square.
WICKET
Buttler b Bopara 62 (Originals 117-4)
Ohhhh, that is clever from Ravi Bopara!
His slower one is just too good for Jos Buttler, and his entertaining knock is over much to the disappointment of the home crowd.
And there's a nice, laid-back celebration from the ex-England player just to rub it in.
Originals 117-3
Ravi Bopara is on with his wobbly medium-pacers from the Brian Statham End.
Jos Buttler gets two more when Dan Lawrence fumbles a long barrier in the offside, allowing the Originals skipper back for the second. Is a bowler allowed to shout at his skipper when that happens?
WICKET
Evans b Dawson 1 (Originals 113-3)
Well, that didn't last long.
Dawson tempts Evans to come down the track but he gets some purchase off the pitch, it squeezes between bat and pad and clips the bails.
Paul Walter joins Jos Buttler.
WICKET
Holden st Rossington b Critchley 24 (Originals 111-2)
The left-hander is lured down the track by the leg-spinner, and Adam Rossington makes a smart stumping to send him on his way.
Laurie Evans is the new batter at the crease.
